replies.body: Even though I finished school a long time ago i would love seeing this in NSW schools as well. When i was in School my younger cousin and i love playing Lol when we got home and had different students from different years playing together as a team. It really breaks down walls that generally separate different year groups or even schools.
i think this is really cool and I would love to do this
Have you tried reaching out to a teacher at your school to see what they think? What would they think of this article and initiative? We can help start the conversation :)
Legit if I become a prefect for my school, I will start the conversation with the teachers for the younger years.
Out of curiosity, what's stopping you from approaching a teacher even if you're not a prefect?
may i ask what state and area you are in. Dont have to say what school for privacy reasons

Hello Littlemisscheeky. I am a high school teacher inner city Melbourne and would love to set up an ongoing tournament within my school and against other schools. I am well aware of the logistical issues you would encounter within schools. However I do believe this is a great opportunity for Riot to build their player base from grass roots and also equip young gamers with the right attitude in regards to toxicity and how it is not welcomed. I would like to partner up with Riot and with their help hold tournaments or in an ideal situation a high school based LCS type program. I am happy to communicate with you directly with this as this is the quiet time of year and would be great to plan how we could do this in 2018.

I forgot to mention I have partnered with Riot in the past to host high school based tournaments at a previous school with great success

Hi scabboy, thanks for reaching out! The logistical issues you mention are not new to us, and we've managed to help a few schools in Victoria in this regard already :) We are happy to start the conversation and work together with you. With the support of teachers like yourself, we hope to drive the program forward and unlock this opportunity for more students across Australia, New Zealand, and eventually the world. 

I've just added you as a friend in-game, where we can exchange contacts. Alternatively, DM at https://twitter.com/irene247
I better be invited :P

what rank are they all?
it would be more of a fair chance if each team had similar mmr or ranks to balance out the matches or else it'd be a fiesta and end in 15 mins ff.

if only my school wanted this xd.
Have you tried reaching out to a teacher? :) The answer is always no if you never ask.

Do you know what you would need to start a club, because I asked a teacher and they said they would probably try next year, but they didn't know what making one would entail 
-----
Thanks :)

Share the League High School website with them https://oce.leaguehighschool.com/about/what-are-lol-clubs/ Even if the teacher is looking at starting a club next year, we can start the conversation with them to help with setting it up at their school :)

The ranks varied. It'd be almost impossible to have multiple high schools send teams of just a single rank. AHS T1 was plat average while some others were gold average (there were some silver/bronze though).
I was there. It was a slight fiesta. A team was aced at level 1, down 5k gold in the early game and then came back to win the game.
we had to go against a Challenger I one game. {{sticker:sg-soraka}}

As someone who was there on the Friday i thought it was a overall good experience, the atmosphere was great and there was a lot of respect between all the players no matter who won their games. i have some feedback to maybe help for next year - assuming it will carry on next year which i hope it does, it was a great experience.

- The headsets didn't work for our games, we got help from a staff member to try and fix them but he didn't really know how to. from what i heard none of the headsets worked on the day until right at the end when most had finished their games. maybe choosing slightly better headsets would be better in future.

- Things seemed a little disorganised when it came to the Sportsmanship Workshop, at least on the Friday. most were standing around not really knowing where to go because it was quite behind schedule and some of the staff there didn't really know when it was happening. although when it finally happened it was actually quite good, the conversations i had with other players were good and they were all nice people. (maybe get your rioters familiar with League terms, the rioter doing the workshop didn't know what inting (intentional feeding) was haha!)

- The computer monitors were square, something I and many others weren't used to and the game felt a little weirder because of it. everything felt a little smooshed and a bit odd, although this is a minor complaint.

- The location was great and having food stalls around made it a good place to sit and talk between rounds about what could be learned from the last game and other strategies. the location was also easily accessible, if you couldn't get there by car or bus there is a train station near by making it easier for people a little further away to get there no issue.

- The Riot staff were very nice and welcomed all of us. they were all friendly and did their best to help where they could if someone was having technical difficulties. the Star Guardian Lux and Freljordian Taliyah cosplayers were nice too handing out how they described 'swag League merch' also offering a group picture.

I hope this feedback helps with any future events with schools you guys do, i was there on the Friday so these issues may have not been the case on the Saturday, however i wouldn't know. I'm looking forward to see if next year this will be happening again, it would be a shame to stop it everyone had a great time. despite the criticisms i really enjoyed my time and thank you for doing this for us students, don't get to really do much things we want at our schools but you gave us this opportunity and we are thankful.

Thank you i hope this proves helpful!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Thanks for the feedback :) I'll pass it on to the team. Off the back of the event, have you thought about starting a LoL club with the support of a teacher?

Yeah we plan to get it up and running in early 2018. Looking forward to it!
{{sticker:sg-kiko}}
That's exciting! Out of curiosity, which school is this?

Tatachilla Lutheran College (TLC)
{{sticker:sg-ezreal}}
Oh cool! Is Ms Shores going to be running it?

YOU KNOW EVERYTHING! yes! looking forward to it! i appriciate the fast responce to my original comment by you and The Hanshmear, the thing i love about Riot is how open they are to feedback and how in touch with the community they are, thank you both!
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
Thank you for the kind words :) {{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}
You rule TaL, thanks for the feedback! This is immensely helpful.
It was a good event, especially being the first of it's kind. Riot staff were very welcoming and did a great job at connecting with the community. Nice work guys hope to see more in the future.
Was really great, and all the Riot workers were nice, even got a souvenir that I could use in game :P loved it, hope there will be more events like this in the future

As a participant i had an amazing time and really enjoyed the opportunity to play against other schools. I really hope they run more tournaments like this, we would love to have the chance to compete again.
Anyone know if this could happen in nz?
{{champion:12}} {{summoner:13}} {{item:3007}} {{sticker:katarina-love}}

My school principal said this game was too 'violent' and could possibly give the school a bad image. Apparently, the minister of education didn't allow our school to do it either (According to our principal) The students who signed up including me were really sad.

i don't think private schools will be keen on doing this i would love to do i.
but ill try to reach a teacher out..but i dunno how many people league in my town probaly not enough. any tips before i do reach out for one like persausive techniques? or convincing? i think we can 5v5 minimum with people in only our school would be great since im best player in the whole school xD. i think one way to le the school captains  (students) agreee on my idea and share it with the teachers...halp me i want to do this without messing it up.
i live in a town shepparton - 2hours from melb my school would gladly drive the team there if we suceed so vsing other schools i think would e likely (notre dame college)
YES i think it would be good if we had a NSW Tournament for kids in High School
I tried asking a teacher at my school who I thought might agree with me and he just laughed at me and called it a stupid idea :(

Does anyone know if there are any events like this in Northland, New Zealand? I've had small clubs with friends that get together and play at lunch times as we are a gaming club, but never been involved with any Event/Tournament, I would love to participate in something like this event in Adelaide, any one know of anything?
Have you heard of the High School League in NZ? http://letsplay.live/hsl/ They've just finished season 2 for 2017, but be sure to keep yourself updated on what they are doing for 2018.
DO ONE IN SYDNEY PLEASE{{sticker:sg-lux}}

The Powerhouse Museum (in Sydney) is running a League of Legends learning day https://maas.museum/program/league-of-legends-learning-hub/ Unfortunately they have just closed registrations. If you want to keep up-to-date with the High School League of Legends Clubs initiative, sign up to our mailing list here https://oce.leaguehighschool.com/ (scroll to the bottom of the page)
We are having one at Power House Museum in Sydney from from 22/11/17 to 25/11/17
was wondering if this would be on the home page.I really wanted to participate but will this happen next year? i just came as a spectator.

Nothing confirmed, but if you want to keep up-to-date with high school events and news, be sure to sign up to our mailing list at https://oce.leaguehighschool.com/ (scroll down to the bottom). Or even see if there's a teacher in your school that would support a LoL club, so that if another event comes around, your school can attend with a team prepared :)
South Australia got some love <3
